abstract_summ: In accordance with the Preferred Reporting Items for Systematic Reviews and Meta-Analyses method, we extracted study location, design, DM definition, covariates, comparison groups, outcomes, and relative risks and/or hazard ratios.STUDY SELECTION: Studies assessing biomarkers for ARDS development in critically ill patients at risk for ARDS and mortality due to ARDS adjusted in multivariate analyses were included.CONCLUSIONS: Biomarker data reporting and variables used in multivariate analyses differed greatly between studies.RESULTS: We suggest a novel pathophysiological mechanism by which acute inflammation from COVID-19 may augment existing chronic inflammation, in order to potentiate a ‘cytokine storm’ and thus the more severe disease phenotype observed in the BAME population.METHODS We searched PubMed, EMBASE, Google Scholar, and CINAHL for full-text English studies from 1970 to 12/31/2017.
title_summ: A systematic review of biomarkers multivariately associated with acute respiratory distress syndrome development and mortalityEconomic menace of diabetes in India: a systematic reviewDiabetes mellitus and colorectal carcinoma outcomes: a meta-analysis.Diabetes & Metabolic Syndrome: Clinical Research & Reviews COVID-19 and Ethnicity: A Novel Pathophysiological Role for Inflammation
title_abstract_phrases: In accordance with the Preferred Reporting Items for Systematic Reviews and Meta-Analyses method, we extracted study location, design, DM definition, covariates, comparison groups, outcomes, and relative risks and/or hazard ratios.STUDY SELECTION: Studies assessing biomarkers for ARDS development in critically ill patients at risk for ARDS and mortality due to ARDS adjusted in multivariate analyses were included.CONCLUSIONS: Biomarker data reporting and variables used in multivariate analyses differed greatly between studies.METHODS We searched PubMed, EMBASE, Google Scholar, and CINAHL for full-text English studies from 1970 to 12/31/2017.RESULTS: We suggest a novel pathophysiological mechanism by which acute inflammation from COVID-19 may augment existing chronic inflammation, in order to potentiate a ‘cytokine storm’ and thus the more severe disease phenotype observed in the BAME population.
